item.title: 'Proving' Euler's formula to calculus students
item.description: Back in high school when I took AP Calc BC I encountered integration using partial fractions. Later, while fooling around with the idea I realized I could use it to connect trigonometric functions, imaginary numbers, and the complex exponential. I didn’t think much of it at the time, but shortly thereafter I learned of Euler’s formula and realized that I had stumbled upon a way to “prove” this relation using integration techniques familiar to most students of calculus.
